section_22.title: Amendment of other written laws
section_22.change_description: Updated references to change 'Director of Medical and Sanitary Services' to 'Director of Health Services' across all legislation

section_23.title: Savings for contracts
section_23.change_description: Ensured continuity of contracts when department name changed from 'Department of Medical and Sanitary Services' to 'Department of Health'

amendments_analysis.significance: Low - purely administrative renaming to reflect department restructuring
notes: This was a consequential amendment following the establishment of the new Department of Health structure in 1952
Changed title from 'Director of Medical and Sanitary Services' to 'Director of Health Services'
No changes to Health Council, Regional Boards, or Hospital Committees

section_4.title: Term of office for Health Council members
section_4.change_description: Inserted new subsection establishing 2-year terms for nominated members of Health Council
section_4.text: Every member of the Health Council who is nominated by the Minister under subsection (1) of this section shall, unless he earlier vacates office by resignation, hold office for a period of two years commencing from the date of his nomination. Any member who vacates office by effluxion of time shall be eligible for re-nomination.
section_4.impact_on_meetings: MEDIUM - Established rotation of nominated members every 2 years

amendments_analysis.meeting_related_changes: Introduced term limits for Health Council nominated members
amendments_analysis.significance: Medium - Added governance structure and member rotation to Health Council
notes: Added stability and rotation to Health Council membership
Ex-officio members (Director, Deputy Directors) not affected by term limits

section_5.title: Health services, institutions and general facilities
section_5.change_description: Updated constitutional reference from 'Ceylon (Constitution and Independence) Orders in Council, 1946 and 1947' to 'Article 150 of the Constitution'
section_5.reason: Sri Lanka adopted new Constitution in 1972, then 1978 Constitution

amendments_analysis.significance: Low - updated constitutional references following 1972/1978 constitutional changes
amendments_analysis.context: Sri Lanka became a Republic in 1972 and adopted a new Constitution in 1978, requiring updates to constitutional references
notes: Changed reference from colonial-era Constitution to republican Constitution
No substantive changes to powers, functions, or meeting structures

section_4.title: Health Council composition
section_4.change_description: Added mandatory Dentist position to Health Council
section_4.original_text: not more than seven Medical Practitioners nominated by the Minister, three of whom must be respectively officers of the medical, surgical and obstetrical sections of the department
section_4.amended_text: not more than seven Medical Practitioners nominated by the Minister, three of whom must be respectively officers of the medical, surgical and obstetrical sections of the department and one Dentist who is an officer in the dental section of the department
section_4.impact_on_meetings: MEDIUM - Increased Health Council membership from max 11 to max 12 members, added dental profession representation

amendments_analysis.meeting_related_changes: Added Dentist as permanent member of Health Council
amendments_analysis.significance: Medium - Expanded professional representation on Health Council to include dentistry
amendments_analysis.rationale: Recognition of dentistry as distinct medical specialty requiring representation in health policy
amendments_analysis.full_text_available: No - inferred from comparing 1956 and current versions
notes: Increased total Health Council membership by 1 (from 11 to 12 max)
Dentist must be an officer in the dental section of the department
Dentist is a nominated member with 2-year term (subject to Section 4(1A))
Reflects growing importance of dental health in national health policy
Amendment made 2 years before Provincial Councils Act devolution in 1989
